citations.narrative:
On August 8, 2024, a kestrel was on exhibit at the county fair when startled by a photographer. The kestrel reacted by
leaping off its perch. The jesses attached to a leash broke and the kestrel flew to the top of a light pole. Multiple capture
methods were implemented over a 8.5hour period, but the bird evaded capture with each attempt and flew away. Park
Rangers and a falconer set-up baited traps and searched for the kestrel for a week as witnesses reported seeing and
hearing the bird. Despite these efforts, the kestrel was not recovered. Search efforts ceased on August 19, 2024.
At the time of inspection, the kestrel had not been seen or heard from for weeks. The bird was never captured. Improper
handling of animals increases the risk of escape. The facility must reassess their tethering process to ensure birds are
handled as carefully as possible to minimize trauma and unnecessary discomfort during public exhibition. Correct by
September 30, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
